title: Bank Of America Settles With Feds And States For Record Amount
teaser: In the latest fallout from misdeeds leading up to the financial crisis, Bank of America has agreed to a record $16.65 billion deal with federal and state governments. The deal helps the bank avoid prosecution for the fraudulent sale of toxic mortgage-backed securities to investors.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
